title: Remember the G&B boards before RiotRepertoir?
body: It feels like that again except more Mordekaiser posts and less Reds.

replies.body:
I do apologize for my disappearance from the forums lately. We've been making a pretty hard push on getting all the pieces aligned for preseason, which I've personally had a pretty large hand in many of the champion changes for, and that's been keeping me pretty busy. One thing that's somewhat unfortunate is that I enjoy sharing details on which champions I'm working on and what kinds of changes we're thinking of making, but at the same time, we don't want to disclose full details until around PBE time, so it leaves me in this situation where I can talk about what I'm working on but not really get into specifics. I think players would probably find that frustrating, like I'm talking to them but not really saying anything.

That said, I am really excited for what the preseason changes hold, and I expect to be a much more vocal presence here once we've revealed/released those changes, since I'm sure there will be plenty of feedback to be had at that point.

That makes complete sense. At least we know you're still here. Thanks for showing yourself, no Rioter should really have to be afraid of their own boards. Not even CertainlyT.

Very excited for pre-season, and hope the meta actually feels more diverse this time.

_Should_ being the operative word. As it stands, there are plenty of reasons to avoid the boards. 

All the more reason to praise Repertoir for braving our wrath, I suppose.

I don't know if you've noticed, but Repertoir gets almost nothing but praise in these boards.

Maybe it's because he actively engages with us and gives us an explanation for his design choices while trying to meet us halfway.

I never meant to imply the contrary. 

What I meant was... RiotRepetoir is like, the only Rioter who the boards will consistently talk civilly to. Him and maybe IronStylus, but he's pretty rare these days. They're pretty charismatic people. But dapcutscene says that "no Rioter should really have to be afraid of their own boards. Not even CertainlyT." Every time CertainlyT comes here his posts are mass-downvoted and shit on, no matter the context. 

While I agree that no Rioter SHOULD be afraid of the boards... I honestly wouldn't blame them for staying away. Devs are people too, yknow? They have emotions. Yeah, they fuck up sometimes, but nobody deserves to be subjected to some of the shit we say. 

I dno. I've just always had an aversion to Riot-bashing. Like, yeah I get it, you're frustrated. But you know, they made this game out of nothing, they made it free, and you're playing it. If you're upset, don't take it out on other humans, just leave. That's my two-cents

I think people are a lot less mean than their posts let on, most are able to be perfectly civil once rioters show up.

Thing is, just ignoring it and hoping it goes away just worsens public opinion.

I don't get he circle jerk for RiotRepertoir. All he ever did was come into thread as say "I don't know how we would fix that whats your opinion" and then leave with nothing ever being done.  It just seemed like he posted so people would shut up about no reds on the boards, but if I wrong please show me all the balance changes made to the game that came form his appearance on these boards.

You're right Repertoir could almost never solve our problems and always asked us, but I think that's what mattered the most. A Rioter who was involved with the community and always asked our opinions and then gave his own.

That's the point of thread in general, to give your opinion and discuss it with others. We already have plenty of that going on with normal posters, with reds you expect answers not a reply that anyone could make. When that happens its just as valuable as a normal poster so you might as well not consider it anything special.

Except when a normal poster comes up with a good idea and the Red likes it. They can get it changed.

It's the difference between a normal poster saying we need to change Mordekaiser and a Red saying we need to change Mordekaiser.

As I stated earlier show me where this has happened with RiotRepertoir, other than Garen I can't think of a single time I've seen a discussion with him actual lead to any real balance changes to a champion.

In case you haven't noticed the boards have been filled for weeks with "we need to change morde" post, hasn't resulted in anything yet. And even if a red acknowledges one it still doesn't mean it will result in a change, more doubtful that it be one that people are asking for. Unless a red comes into a thread and says we like these changes and are going to implement them or actually provides information about the changes they are considering, there is no point about making a big deal out of a red response if it is no more useful than any other speculation post.

I think it's a matter of actually knowing for sure what is going on on Riot's side of things. It's great to have so many normal posters share their thoughts, but at the end of the day, only the reds have the power to actually change anything.

the thing that he did is providing information, giving some insight on riots wherabouts, it's a huge difference betweem guessing what their plans for morde are and knowing that they aren't sure them selfs for example.

Literally the only thing about balance I've ever seen him answer confidently is about Garen, which if I'm not mistaken was his personal project in the juggernaut change. Any other thing about balance from sona to cass to quinn, just some examples, and he never "provides informantion" he just post so it looks like the thread got red attention when in reality nothing is ever learned or done. 

As for your example about morde, "guessing what their plans for morde are and knowing that they aren't sure them selfs" still results in no useful information. Him saying I don't know what were gonna do doesn't prepare me for the changes or allow me to get a new game plan before the changes arrive.
Let's be honest here, showing up is still better than not showing up at all.  He might have not always had something useful to say, but he was there.

well, to be fair, atleast meddler shows up every now and then, but it's still a tad sad how much the red activitys went down again, i realy hoped they keep it up.
Though i still want to thank them for atleast that period in which we had a lot red activity, was quite nice.
